result.execSummary:
The defendant Vert L Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur & concur to any other case.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368 paid in full from bond.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.  Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TW without written approval from Agent.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

Trial judge -  Br 2

Defendant in court with Attorney Anthony C. Delyea.  Joseph E. Mimier appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Tiquina W.
- Defendant shall not be in the 7100 Blk of Flower Ln, Madison.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,500 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Tiquina W.
